intro: Pilosella sororians, commonly known as the common mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and hairy stems, which give it its scientific name. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are spoon-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Pilosella sororians is often found in Europe and parts of Asia, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
